snippet.title: 94-Year-Old Billionaire To Marry For The 5th Time, Jokes That He Wants More Kids
snippet.description: Austrian retail tycoon Karl Wlaschek (net worth: $4.7 billion), who plans to get married in the next few days, is the fifth-oldest billionaire in the world. read »

snippet.title: Laugh Now, But Here's Why The Yankees Will Be Champs
snippet.description: (New) Yankee Stadium, Jul 2009 - 14 (Photo credit: Ed Yourdon) The jokes about the aging New York Yankees – their prospective lineup is easily the oldest in Major League Baseball – are legion: The most expensive nursing home in the world is Yankee Stadium. snippet.title: The Race to Communicate - Was Malaysia Airlines Right to Text The Lost Plane?
snippet.description: You never know when a crisis might happen to your organization. But leaders need to plan for communications in advance of trouble so they maintain trust and not err when the message is difficult. read »

snippet.title: How A World Boxing Champion Turned Politician
snippet.description: To the world, Vitali Klitschko is known as a heavyweight WBC champion from Ukraine -- the oldest of the two famous Klitschko brothers, tough world-class boxers. In his mid-thirties, he decided to pick up a different kind of fight, no less rough than boxing—Ukrainian politics. Vitali Klitschko Beats Dereck Chisora, February [...]

snippet.title: Video: Inside CVS Headquarters With CMO Rob Price
snippet.description: You may not see an abundance of its commercials on TV, but CVS/pharmacy, the retail division of CVS/Caremark, has been working hard in another way to get noticed—and distance itself from the competition: by creating a highly personalized shopping experience, both in-store and via digital channels. Senior VP and CMO Rob [...] read »

snippet.title: King Of Craft Beer: How Sierra Nevada Is Winning The Hops War
snippet.description: Decades before the boutique beer boom Ken Grossman tasted opportunity. Sierra Nevada is now a juggernaut--and he might be worth $800 million. read »

snippet.title: Games are Art, But Hilary Goldstein is Still Right
snippet.description: Tiny Wings (Photo credit: Wikipedia) It’s the oldest argument in the video game world. Are games art? People love to say yes, people love to say no. snippet.title: Wharton's Cappelli On Why Older Workers Do It Better
snippet.description: VideoThe book I am writing this summer is about young people - how we love them, nurture them and focus on them. Wharton's Peter Cappelli, thinks we have got wrong.
